lines.text: And she's a film girl too. Most film girls look like Peter Lorre.
Hi, my name's Adam, and I don't have an act. And not having an act is my act.
Yeah? Well, you see this watch? This watch holds twenty numbers. Twenty numbers.
Sure, that works for you, cause you're Sean, and everybody loves Sean. You're the fucking Pete Rose of women.
Hey, the coffee shop's hiring. I bet you could get a job.
No thanks. I'm happy with the one I've got.
[Jason snatches a cigarette from Pete's mouth.]
Did I mention that I've got V.D.?
Well, what makes you think I'd want to go out with you?
Because the other night at the bar, you looked back.
I looked back. So?
So you don't have to watch a lot of romantic comedies to know what that means.
So, what's it mean?
It means... that the girl wants the guy, so can we just get past this awkward part and you say yes?
He just totally dissed the director. That man is gonna be a star.
If you could just forget how scared you can be sometimes, and listen to your heart, you just might impress yourself.
Somebody said it's raining outside.
Oh no.
What? Every good romantic comedy needs a rain scene.
But this isn't a movie.
Life's kinda like a movie sometimes.
Hey, Lauren, you got a minute?
I don't know, I'm a little busy.
Who's the director here?
Hey, there are two people on a set you don't tell what to do and that's the key grip and the gaffer.
And you're neither.
So let's talk.
